Incident.Summary: THEFT OF MOTOR VEHICLE. COMPLAINANT WAS IN JAIL DURING THEFT. VEHICLE USED BY SEPARATE SUSPECT FOR ROBBERY IN PA.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
SCENE PROCESSING:

    I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, am equipped with a body-worn camera, which was recording during this incident. 

NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK:

    A neighborhood check was not conducted. 

SUSPECT:

    NAME: TIMOTHY JOHN MORGAN (W/M)
    DATE OF BIRTH: APRIL 9, 1972
    ADDRESS: 229 WEAVER MEADOWS RD, CONOWINGO, MD
    MARYLAND SOUNDEX: MD10272036617

NARRATIVE:

    On August 19, 2023, at approximately 1054 hours, I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, was dispatched to 2786 Jacob Tome Memorial Highway, Colora, Maryland in response to the theft of a motor vehicle. I arrived on scene at approximately 1112 hours. 

    Upon arrival, I made contact with the complainant, Jeffrey Walter Blakeley (W/M; DOB: 03/27/1966), referred to from here as Jeff. Jeff told me he purchased a silver-in-color 2006 Saturn Vue (unknown VIN, no known registration) from Joseph John Juergens (W/M; DOB: 12/16/1969). Jeff said Juergens turned the vehicle's registration plates over to the MVA after the transaction, and that the paperwork for the transaction is inside the vehicle itself. 

    I learned upon dispatch and through conversation with Jeff that the Saturn Vue was used in a robbery. The vehicle is apparently impounded in Pennsylvania, but Jeff says the suspect who used the vehicle in the robbery is not the same individual who stole the vehicle. Jeff said Timothy John Morgan (see "SUSPECT") is the person who actually stole the vehicle, and then presumably gave it to the robbery suspect in Pennsylvania. Jeff told me the theft occurred on or around July 27, 2023, and the vehicle was stolen from 2786 Jacob Tome Memorial Highway from what I gathered. 

    Jeff said he was incarcerated during the time of the theft. However, he said he has witnesses who can attest to the theft. One of the witnesses is a resident of 2786 Jacob Tome Memorial Highway. I made contact with this individual, identified as Donna Boone (W/F; DOB: 05/18/1965). When I spoke to Donna, she told me she personally saw Morgan board the driver's seat of the Saturn Vue before starting its engine and driving away with it. Donna and Jeff said they believe Morgan got permission from Jeff's ex-girlfriend, Brina Mitchell (W/F; DOB: 10/04/1980), to take the vehicle. However, both Donna and Jeff said Brina had no ownership rights of the vehicle, and therefore was not in a position to actually give permission. Jeff and Donna said Morgan never actually got legitimate permission from Jeff to take the vehicle. From what I gathered, the ignition key was simply left in the vehicle and Morgan apparently boarded the vehicle without forcing his way into it. 

    Jeff also said he had at least $5,000.00 worth of carpentry equipment in the vehicle. He didn't name any specific tools, but mentioned the vehicle contained the likes of saws, drills, etc. He did not have serial numbers, but said he may be able to find the serial numbers for two chainsaws that were stolen with the vehicle. I gave him my government email and asked him to email me any serial numbers he uncovers. Otherwise, he said many of the tools have his initials on them. 

    Jeff went on to tell me he also heard Morgan keeps the tools in a shed or garage (he mentioned both during conversation). However, Jeff heard this from someone else. He asked if I could check Morgan's residence, but I explained to him that I cannot enter Morgan's residence/storehouse without a warrant/permission, and there is also additional difficulty given Jeff did not have serial numbers readily available. 

    At the time of initial investigation, Jeff was equipped with an ankle monitor, which apparently impedes his ability to travel and apply for charges. When asked, he told me he is due to have the monitor removed in November 2023. I told him to apply for criminal charges against Morgan as soon as the ankle monitor is legally removed. I told him he has a year and one day from July 27, 2023 to apply for charges. I provided him with a victim/witness brochure to include my name/rank/identification number, the case number, and the non-emergency telephone line for the Maryland State Police North East Barrack. 

    After talking to Jeff and Donna, I cleared the scene. 

    Later, I checked Juergens through METERS to ascertain whether he still has a Saturn vehicle registered to him. Interestingly, Juergens' MVA record lists a Maryland registration of 5FE4373. That registration lists a VIN of 5GZCZ53476S856700 on a Saturn Vue. The registration is listed as an active plate, but its status reads "Vehicle Registration Suspended." It's unconfirmed at the moment, but this is most likely the vehicle Jeff referenced. The registered owner still shows as Juergens on METERS. 

    I request this case be suspended pending an application for charges from Jeff. 

    All events occurred in Cecil County, Maryland.

Focus of this supplement:
To explain how members of the MSP SOG-N encountered Timothy Morgan and ultimately arrested him based off the incident captured under CC# 23-MSP-029301

Narrative:

On 10/10/2023 at approximately 1600 hours, Sgt. Cox and D/Sgt. Peterson of the Maryland State Police Strategic Operations Group arrived to 229 Weaver Meadow Road, Conowingo, Maryland regarding an incident involving trespassing. Troopers contacted the homeowner, identified as Marilyn Leonard, who advised Troopers that she needed information on how to deal with trespassers on her property. Leonard advised that she resides at the roughly 12-acre property with her son, Timothy Morgan, who for a short period of time would let friends stay in the garage on the property. After a recent incident of two unknown males observed walking around a neighbor's property and entering a barn, Leonard told Morgan that his friends are no longer permitted to be on the property.

Leonard allowed Troopers into the shed and an additional outbuilding, which was a metal frame with a tarp attached. Inside the shed, Troopers observed drug paraphernalia in plane view. The items observed were folded pieces of burnt aluminum foil. Through their training, knowledge, and experience Troopers know that CDS, more particularly crystal methamphetamine, is ingested into the human body by this manner. Inside the other tarp covered outbuilding, Troopers observed a hypodermic syringe coupled with a torn small glassine baggy. Troopers know through their training, knowledge, and experience that the small glassine baggy is the type that would contain wax paper baggies containing heroin/fentanyl mix. Troopers also know that the syringes are used by heroin/fentanyl users to introduce the CDS into their body.

After explaining the paraphernalia to Leonard, she became upset that this type of behavior was occurring on her property. Leonard provided Morgan's phone number to Troopers who contacted Morgan via cell phone. Troopers attempted to schedule a day and time to meet with Morgan to address the trespassing and drug usage incidents, but Morgan advised that he was currently busy renovating a bathroom for a customer. Morgan did tell Troopers that he informed the individuals that were staying on the property not to return and if anyone were to be observed on the property that he and his mother would press charges for trespassing.

Prior to leaving the residence, Troopers advised Leonard that she should have Morgan take down the make-shift outbuilding and lock the shed, so the trespassers can't return to the residence.

After leaving the residence, Troopers responded to 370 Old Mill Road, Conowingo, MD, a residence Troopers know Morgan frequents. As Troopers arrived, they observed a black Chevrolet pick-up truck bearing Maryland registration 6Z5724 parked in front of the property. An MVA check revealed the vehicle was registered to Timothy Morgan. A check through NCIC/MILES revealed that Morgan possessed an outstanding warrant through the North East Barrack for motor vehicle/unlawful taking and theft $1500 to $25000 (Warrant # D230189901). The warrant was confirmed and Troopers repeatedly knocked on the front and rear door of the residence to contact the homeowner and/or Morgan. After approximately 20 to 30 minutes of knocking and announcing without any answer, an additional homeowner returned to the residence who allowed Troopers inside.

Once inside the residence, Troopers contacted Morgan and placed him under arrest without incident. Search incident to arrest revealed that Morgan possessed, on his person (Change pocket of his jeans), one clear zip lock bag containing a blue wax paper which contained a white powder. The blue wax bag was stamped “FAXS” in red ink. Through their training, knowledge, and experience Troopers knew the substance to be heroin/fentanyl mixture.

Morgan was transported to the MSP North East Barrack for processing. While at the barrack, Morgan was read his Miranda rights and agreed to speak with Sgt. Cox. Sgt. Cox advised Morgan that the warrant involved a vehicle theft. The following was learned during the interview:

-Morgan’s ex-girlfriend’s name is Briana Rhoades.
-Morgan was aware of the vehicle that was involved and described it as a small silver Saturn SUV. He originally stated it was a van
-Morgan stated that Briana Rhoades’ ex-boyfriend was Jeff Blakeley, and he lived on Wyatt Lane
-Morgan believed “they” were trying to extort him for money and Morgan blocked his (Blakeley’s) calls and texts
-Originally, Morgan said that Briana had driven the vehicle to his house, but then changed his story to tell Sgt. Cox that he met Briana at Donna’s (Boone) house. Briana had just gotten out of the vehicle when Morgan pulled up. Morgan stated that he had driven his mom's car to Donna's residence to meet with Briana.
-Morgan said that he was just going over to the house to see Briana, and she advised that she had to run a few errands. Morgan stated that he knew the vehicle wasn't legal, so he told Briana to take his mom's car to run her errands.
-Morgan drove the silver Saturn to his residence where it stayed parked for two days. Morgan advised he didn't know what was in the vehicle and didn't take any items out of the vehicle. He did not drive the vehicle during the two days. Nobody inquired about the vehicle during the two days.
-After two days Morgan contacts Briana to tell her his mom wants the vehicle off the property. Morgan stated that he drove to Donna's in his car to pick up Briana to bring her back to his house, so she could get the silver Saturn. Morgan stated that he did not follow Briana back to Donna's but only knew that she (Briana) had left his property with the silver Saturn.
-Morgan believed that this incident occurred in June or sometime during the summer.
-Morgan couldn't understand why he has a warrant against him for the vehicle.
Morgan was eventually transported to the Cecil County District Court Commissioner's Office for the warrant service. The single bag of CDS Morgan possessed was weighed and verified at 1 gram and stored in the BK F CDS Locker to await analysis. Morgan was later transported to the Cecil County Detention Center where he was held on a $3500.00 bond.

All events occurred in Cecil County, MD.
